intro: Lychnis eriostemon, commonly known as the red campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring simple, alternate, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers in clusters at the ends of its stems, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its flowers have five petals and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Lychnis eriostemon is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in full sun to partial shade.
